definition: lit. to discuss sb's merits and demerits (idiom); to gossip
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: George enjoys talking about people’s private affairs. He is a gossip. (2003.9)
sentences.chinese: 乔治喜欢谈论别人的私事，他是个爱说长道短的人。

sentences.english: He said that wouldnt be enough. I end up counselling people about it because Ive been through it.
sentences.chinese: 由于我是过来人，所以不愿对此事说长道短。

sentences.english: Her disheveled appearance when she arrives is meat for Caroline's gossip, but Mrs.
sentences.chinese: 她到达时的狼狈相，为卡罗琳说长道短提供了话柄。

sentences.english: Do you share the view that too many people are talking too much about China?
sentences.chinese: 关于中国说长道短的人太多了，你同意这种看法吗？

sentences.english: I know how people chatter in england .
sentences.chinese: 我知道英国人会怎样说长道短。

sentences.english: She can spend a whole day gossiping with her neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 她能一整天都跟邻居们说长道短。

sentences.english: "Depression is pretty serious and should not be gossiped about," she said.
sentences.chinese: 她说“抑郁症是很严肃的事情，不应该被说长道短。”

sentences.english: I don't like lazy people or people who gossip.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢和懒人或是爱说长道短的人工作。

sentences.english: Two old hens from the neighbored were standing on the corner gossiping .
sentences.chinese: 有两个邻居老婆子站在街角上说长道短。

sentences.english: There's nothing I like less than gossiping .
sentences.chinese: 我最不喜欢的莫过于说长道短了。

sentences.english: Gossiping is a bad habit that we should avoid.
sentences.chinese: 说长道短是坏习惯，我们要避免这种恶习。

sentences.english: According to the gossip, Mr. Ede is absolutely furious.
sentences.chinese: 据爱说长道短的人说爱德先生肯定是暴跳如雷。

sentences.english: Let's stop gossiping and get back to work.
sentences.chinese: 让我们停止说长道短，回到工作中吧。

sentences.english: Her disheveled appearance when she arrives is meat for Caroline's gossip.
sentences.chinese: 她到达时的狼狈相，为卡罗琳说长道短提供了话柄。

sentences.english: Three old hens are standing on the corner gossiping.
sentences.chinese: 有三个老婆子正站在街角上说长道短。

sentences.english: Three oldhens from the neighbored were standing on the cornergossiping.
sentences.chinese: 有三个邻居老婆子站在街角上说长道短。

definition: to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief

pinyin: dong1 jia1 chang2 xi1 jia1 duan3

definition: lit. to argue who is right and wrong (idiom); to quibble/a storm in a teacup
to make idle remarks about a woman's appearance (idiom)
to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
to gossip and meddle/to shoot one's mouth off/talkative
to gesticulate while talking (idiom); to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily/also written 指手畫腳|指手画脚

lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/to remark upon a person's appearance/nitpicking/overcritical/judgmental
to spread malicious gossip/also written 飛短流長|飞短流长[fei1 duan3 liu2 chang2]
